Faculty Guide
  • IITM Main Web Page
  1. Leaves & Travel
  2. Types of Leaves

Table of contents

  • General Leaves
  • Professional Leaves from Institute
  • Child care related leaves
  • Types of Visits
  • Non-working days can be prefixed/ suffixed to all leaves and vacation. Embedding of non-working days (where non-working days within a leave period will not be counted as leave) is permitted only in SCL & ICSR-SCL.
  • Unused CL, SCL, lapses on Dec 31 each year & cannot be carried forward. There may be provision of carrying forward other leaves as per the details given below.
  • To serve on committees as a representative of IITM (based on request by administration) and for specific academic activities at the insistence of MoE, AICTE, etc. with/without Institute finance, the Director may approve the visit as on-duty.

General Leaves

Type of
Leave		Duration
in days		Purpose & Remarks
Casual Leave (CL)8 / yr• For personal/ any other reasons
• Cannot exceed 8 days at a stretch including prefix/ suffix.
• Can be taken for half-day.
• Can be combined with SCL/Vacation but not with any other leave.
Half-Pay Leave (HPL)10 for every 6 monthsMedical grounds / personal reasons
Commuted Leave (CmL): special provision for commuting HPLDepends on medical condition. Max ( along with EL, if taken) 240.• Medical grounds (based on medical certificate endorsed by IITM CMO)
• CmL is with full pay.
• For 1 day of CmL, 2 days of HPL deducted.
• ‘Fit to join duty’ certificate by IITM CMO to be submitted while rejoining.
Vacation (can be suffixed / prefixed with EL/HPL)60 days within the windows declared by IITM in summer & winter• 1 EL credit for every 2 days of vacation not taken.
• New faculty: 2 days vacation per 12 days of service in the academic year.
• Travel using SCL, ICSR-SCL etc is considered as working during vacation.
• Vacation can be used for professional visits to take up paid position (min. 30 days)
Earned Leave (EL)Max 180 at a stretch• No reasons to be provided
• EL can be accrued only by working during vacation: 2 days of working during vacation = 1 day of EL.
15 days of EL is credited to the employee on Jan 1 & Jul 1 every year.
• Unused EL can be encashed anytime (lifetime cap of 300 days). ‘Encashed’ ⇒ convert EL to money. 1 EL equivalent to 1 day’s salary reckoned as of the time of encashment. 
• In addition to the 300 days cap mentioned above, up to 10 days of EL may be encashed for every Leave Travel Concession (LTC) availed, capped at 60 days for lifetime.
• All encashed ELs, except at the time of retirement, are subject to income tax.
• Maximum EL balance that can be carried forward is 300 days + 15 days credit received on Jan/July.
• Can be combined with any leave except CL.
• Intervening holidays will be treated as EL.
Extra- ordinary Leave (EOL)1 yr per 5 yrs of service
Max 4 yrs, limited to 2 yrs at a time		• Short/Long term assignments for R&D activities/ Fellowship/ Visiting positions elsewhere/ due to Sickness (Medical Certificate required)/ personal situations
• No pay or allowance from IITM. Can get paid from host organization.
• Minimum service of 5 yrs (3 years on a case-to-case basis) before availing EOL.
• Sabbatical & EOL entitlement are linked.

Professional Leaves from Institute

Type of
Leave		Duration
in days		Purpose & Remarks
Sabbatical Leave (SL)Min 4 months. Max 1 year• Temporary R&D/ academic assignments in other universities or research institutions or industries, availing fellowships, writing books etc. The offer letter from the host organization has to be produced.
• Eligibility- Continuous service for 3 years after becoming a regular faculty.
• 2 months SL credited per year of continuous service.
• The Board of Governors (BoG) of IITM, the granting body, meets once in 3-4 months. So, apply at least 4 months in advance.
• During SL: full salary from IITM; retention of quarters.
• Host institution cannot give regular salary during SL. The letter from the host institution should clearly indicate that you are only being paid an honorarium or living allowance.
• BoG may permit adding up to 60 (or 120) days of EL/ HPL/ SCL/ ICSR SCL if SL is less than 6 (or more than 6) months.
• Have to furnish a bond to serve the Institute for one year on return to duty.
• Post SL for 4/ 4-8/ 8-12 months, min. window of 1/2/3 years, respectively, before taking the next SL.
Special Casual Leave (SCL)15 / yr• Conferences/ Workshops with/without paper
• Committee meetings not treated as ‘on-duty’
• PhD viva elsewhere
ICSR SCL6 / month during semester; 15 each during winter & summer• Travel related to project & continuing education.
• Can be accumulated to a maximum of 30 days. Accumulated leave can be availed only during summer/ winter.
Professional VisitMin 30- Max 45• Paid position during vacation
• Separate paperwork has to be done (admin 1), not part of workflow.
Start-Up Sabbatical1 yr??To support & promote start-ups

Child care related leaves

Type of
Leave		Duration
in days		Purpose & Remarks
Maternity LeaveMaternity - 6 Months (for up to 2 surviving children)
Miscarriage - 6 Weeks		• Maternity/ Adoption/ Miscarriage. Medical Certificate should be produced.
• Will not be debited in leave account.
• Can be combined with any other leave except CL.
Paternity Leave15 (including Sat / Sun & intervening holidays)- for up to 2 surviving children• Paternity/ Adoption
• From 15 days before to 6 months after the date of delivery of the child. 15 days from the date of valid adoption of a child. It will lapse if the leave is not availed within this period.
Child Care Leave (CCL)730 during the service till 2nd surviving child reaches the age of 18. Min period of 5 days• Child Care
• Eligibility - Women or widowed/divorced father
• Not more than 3 times in a calendar year.
• 100% of salary for the first 365 days & 80% of the salary for the next 365 days.

Types of Visits

  • Brief – Less than 30 days
  • Short - 30-90 days
  • Long - Above 90 days

These are the standard terminologies used in workflow.
